text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention applicable law incorporation, specifically referencing domestic environmental obligations integrated through Article 42 of the ICSID Convention or analogous custom. The response addresses the 'Applicable law' component (Section 3), noting that tribunals look for an umbrella clause or a 'full protection and security' clause that incorporates domestic law, citing *CMS Energy* as an example where the state used the FPS clause to enforce domestic law obligations. While it does not explicitly name 'Article 42 of the ICSID Convention,' the discussion of incorporating domestic law into the treaty framework to provide a substantive basis for the state's claim (which is the core concept behind using Article 42 or analogous custom in ICSID cases) is clearly present and central to the analysis of the applicable law for state counterclaims.", "criterion_id": "b21bb6a4-a9dd-4787-83a9-afdb78d12f8e"}
